My Parisian Food And Photo Safari

Just me, my iPhone, and my appetite

Linda Horton
Apr 2

When I went to Paris last year, my main goal was to take pictures, and eat. I had been there briefly the year before, but this time I really wanted to dig in. Armed with my Nikon D800, a variety of lenses, and my iPhone, I was off on my adventure.

Even though I lugged my camera gear everywhere, I took most of the pictures with my iPhone, including all of those shown here.

It was a workout, schlepping through Paris carrying that heavy backpack, but ultimately worth it, as that required me to eat more delicious food. And of course I took pics of all (or most) of it, and posted them on Instagram.

I mean, I love the art and architecture and all, but for me it’s all about the food!

Welcome to Paris!

My Parisian Food And Photo Safari

Just me, my iPhone, and my appetite

Linda Horton
Apr 2

When I went to Paris last year, my main goal was to take pictures, and eat. I had been there briefly the year before, but this time I really wanted to dig in. Armed with my Nikon D800, a variety of lenses, and my iPhone, I was off on my adventure.

Even though I lugged my camera gear everywhere, I took most of the pictures with my iPhone, including all of those shown here.

It was a workout, schlepping through Paris carrying that heavy backpack, but ultimately worth it, as that required me to eat more delicious food. And of course I took pics of all (or most) of it, and posted them on Instagram.

I mean, I love the art and architecture and all, but for me it’s all about the food!

Welcome to Paris!

After checking into my adorable Airbnb in Montmartre, wine was the first order of the day!

Sacré-Cœur was within walking distance, and I trudged all the way to the top. Worth it! Wow, what a fantastic view of Paris…

That worked up an appetite for sure! I popped into a little cheese shop and got this fabulous little tray — and more wine!

The Montmartre area is so cool, with street art everywhere. Here’s some of the artwork right on the little street where I was staying…awesome.

There is beautiful food everywhere! Crêpes anyone? Don’t mind if I do!

The bakery is insane, and the pain au chocolat was calling my name that first morning.

Bakeries everywhere! No complaints from me…..

Close to the Eiffel Tower, it was time for lunch! I was kind of addicted to these ham and cheese sandwiches, AKA Croque Monsieur.

Pro Tip — get to the Eiffel Tower at dusk, in time for the first light show. Amazing!

Well, that calls for a little dessert. Did someone say “Trio of Crème Brûlée”? Yes, please!

Next on the agenda — Notre Dame. Again, walked all the way up, and worked up an appetite. Do it!

After that, I needed to eat a big ol’ pizza a la puttanesca, and this one hit the spot. Italian in Paris is A-OK by me!

Now for something sweet! This dark chocolate orange thingy was calling my name. Oh, and more wine!

Of course, I needed to go to the Louvre. I hit all the highlights, then time for lunch…

A civilized museum visit calls for a delicious salad….

Followed by, you guessed it…more Crème Brûlée!

SO much walking, which I love. Paris is a walking city, and these dogs were tired.

This day was spent exploring Le Marais, and included a beautiful picnic lunch at Place des Vosges. There are lots of shops where you can just walk in and purchase a spread like this below, for cheap!

The outdoor cafes are everywhere, where you can sit down and drink and people watch all day or night, which I did many times.

Another day, another museum! Today, Musée d’Orsay. Check out this cool clock, with the Louvre in the background.

After the museum, another delicious salad. Where better to get a Salade Niçoise than Paris! Perfect!

It’s not all heavy sauces and fattening foods in Paris. There is an abundance of fresh and healthy choices, including outdoor produce markets everywhere.

Just a little somethin’ to tide me over. Burrata and fresh tomatoes. And beer.

The Palace of Versailles was a must-see! It’s a bit of a ride outside of Paris, but worth it.

On the last day, I chose to take a long, contemplative walk through the Père Lachaise Cemetery. It was the best decision ever. Don’t miss it.

After that, I treated myself to a big old steak, smothered in Roquefort cheese. Perfect meal to wrap up a beautiful adventure.

Thank you and so long, Paris. Don’t ever change. I’ll be back!

I am a photographer who writes, and eats. Combine those three things and I’m pretty much in Heaven.

Thanks so much for letting me share my delicious adventures in Paris.

Next stop, Barcelona. Tapas anyone?

  • Linda Horton

    Medium member since Dec 2018

    Born a photographer, but prone to writing haiku on public transportation, or baking things, I live in Chicago’s South Loop with my feisty terrier, Sunny.

  • One Table, One World

    People coming from different cultural backgrounds sharing seats at the table to dine, to laugh, to cook, to heal and most of all to share the stories of their unique journeys all over the world.
